title: Erroneous key "postStateHash"?
body:
Most of the tests just use `"postState"` key, but some of them use `"postStateHash"`. Is it on purpose:

```
% git grep 'postStateHash'
BlockchainTests/GeneralStateTests/stCreate2/Create2Recursive.json:        "postStateHash" : "0x6c7c3a06cf21ef299b1e55fb55709ba08da1b127de4d06e3606f2b0337b10172",
BlockchainTests/GeneralStateTests/stCreate2/Create2Recursive.json:        "postStateHash" : "0x705708753f3b3ab20aed200b70666d21b3417d22d060ff0f86d711c28be71554",
BlockchainTests/GeneralStateTests/stQuadraticComplexityTest/Create1000.json:        "postStateHash" : "0x23f378638a22161b41a4de3514463d1977474d1e59e88637d0405cf2c174c8e4",
BlockchainTests/GeneralStateTests/stQuadraticComplexityTest/Create1000Byzantium.json:        "postStateHash" : "0x23f378638a22161b41a4de3514463d1977474d1e59e88637d0405cf2c174c8e4",
BlockchainTests/GeneralStateTests/stRecursiveCreate/recursiveCreateReturnValue.json:        "postStateHash" : "0x118ca95a4f97dd4d457712ff326a4d53f4c2d4a53b9165ea1ecdfdf7b45d94dd",
BlockchainTests/ValidBlocks/bcExploitTest/ShanghaiLove.json:        "postStateHash" : "0xc9fca7d82991becae37b1bbf37862b6fc88a83d2f84c0cedcc5f53a044b98e57",
BlockchainTests/ValidBlocks/bcExploitTest/SuicideIssue.json:        "postStateHash" : "0xf58849af6b56af4ccacaabeb2c722db5d1e67dbe05137de659a1f8ff1648d638",
JSONSchema/bc-schema.json:                "postStateHash": {

LegacyTests/Constantinople/BlockchainTests/GeneralStateTests/stAttackTest/ContractCreationSpam_d0g0v0.json:        "postStateHash" : "0x84598d92156620e810cc65199b4945bf3e29753271e5b5af02e73d3a590e7f43",
```

when the `postState` is too huge (like a few megabytes) it is replaced with `postStateHash`.
TODO: update documentation https://ethereum-tests.readthedocs.io/en/latest/test_types/blockchain_tests.html
